title: Hyper-V ExposeVirtualizationExtensions issue after upgrading to vagrant 1.9.3
body:
### Vagrant version
1.9.3

### Host operating system
Windows 8.1

### Guest operating system
CentOS 7.2

### Vagrantfile
```ruby
Vagrant.configure("2") do |config|
  config.vm.define "mail" do |mail|

    # Bugfix for CentOS and vagrant <= 1.8.5, see https://github.com/mitchellh/vagrant/issues/7610 
    config.ssh.insert_key = false

#    config.r10k.puppet_dir = "."
#    config.r10k.puppetfile_path = "Puppetfile"
#    config.r10k.module_path = "modules"

    mail.vm.hostname = "vagrant-mail"

    mail.vm.network "forwarded_port", guest: 80, host: 8080
    mail.vm.network "forwarded_port", guest: 443, host: 8443
    mail.vm.network "forwarded_port", guest: 8080, host: 8081

    mail.vm.provider :virtualbox do |vb, mail|
      mail.vm.box = "puppetlabs/centos-7.2-64-puppet"
      
      vb.customize ["modifyvm", :id, "--memory", "2048"]
      vb.customize ["modifyvm", :id, "--cpus", "2"]
      vb.customize ["modifyvm", :id, "--ioapic", "on"]
    end
    
    mail.vm.provider 'hyperv' do |hv, mail|
      mail.vm.box = "pascalhegy/centos-7.2-64-puppet-hyperv"
      
      hv.vmname = "vagrant-mail"
      hv.ip_address_timeout = 240
      hv.memory = 2048
      hv.cpus = 2
      hv.differencing_disk = true
    end

    #Deploy eyaml-encrypt for hiera eyaml backend
    mail.vm.provision "shell", inline: "/opt/puppetlabs/puppet/bin/gem install hiera-eyaml --no-ri --no-rdoc"
    mail.vm.provision "file", source: "public_key.pkcs7.pem", destination: "~/keys/public_key.pkcs7.pem"
    mail.vm.provision "file", source: "private_key.pkcs7.pem", destination: "~/keys/private_key.pkcs7.pem"

    mail.vm.provision :puppet do |puppet|
      puppet.facter = {
        "fqdn" => "vagrant-mail",
        "hostname" => "vagrant-mail",
        "domain" => ""
      }
      puppet.options = ["--verbose"]
      puppet.environment = "vagrant"
      puppet.environment_path = "environments"
      puppet.module_path = "modules"
      puppet.hiera_config_path = "configuration/hiera.yaml"
    end
    mail.vm.synced_folder "modules/", "/etc/puppetlabs/code/modules"
    mail.vm.synced_folder "environments", "/etc/puppetlabs/code/environments"
  end

end

```

### Debug output
https://gist.github.com/hegyre/44be3e47ca74849c6b4c67f99669f3ec

### Expected behavior
According to documentation: https://www.vagrantup.com/docs/hyperv/configuration.html#enable_virtualization_extensions

This ExposeVirtualizationExtensions parameter should NOT be mandatory

'Default is not defined. This will be disabled if not set.'

EDIT: Well seems I mixed up enable_virtualization_extensions and expose_virtualization_extensions (or ExposeVirtualizationExtensions ?), which is not documented at all...

### Actual behavior
It seems it asks for this parameters to be in the vagrantfile ???

### Steps to reproduce
1. Just launch vagrant with my vagrant file and force hyper-v as the provider
